subclassFeature.name: Battle Medic Martial Archetype
entries: "I have been in situations where groups I have been assigned to don't have a source of magical healing, and some people take it upon themselves to do the dirty work of being the team medic for an outing. They are still capable warriors, as all adventurers should be. Their knowledge in medical practices have saved several lives. They've acted to patch up the wounded defenders of settlements and to care for the ones who barely return from the carnage of combat. At one point, I was miraculously brought back by one of these physicians. I thought I was gone, but perhaps fate has other plans for me. Even though they don't have any magical abilities to heal, I am grateful for those who persue this practice. I can be pretty brutal on their psyche, but they push through."

subclassFeature.name: Medical Knowledge
entries: You have been trained in the medical field extensively. You gain proficiency in the {@skill Medicine} skill and with {@item herbalism kit|PHB|herbalism kits}.

subclassFeature.name: First Aid
entries: You have learned to give immediate first aid to those who need it. You have a pool of {@dice d8}s that you spend to fuel this healing. The number of dice in the pool is equal to your fighter level. As an action, you can heal one creature that you can see and touch, spending from the pool. The maximum number of dice you can spend at once equals your Wisdom modifier (minimum of one die).
Roll the dice you spend, add them together, and restore a number of hit points equal to the total.
If you have a healer's kit on your person when you use this feature, you can expend one use of it to add your Wisdom modifier (minimum of 1) to the number of hit points a creature restores.
Your pool regains all expended dice when you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Surgical Strike
entries: At 7th level you have knowledge of vital points in a creature's body to strike. Once per turn, when you roll damage for a weapon attack and roll the highest number possible on at least one of the dice, you can roll one additional damage die and add the number rolled to the attack's damage roll.
You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Wisdom modifier (minimum of once), and regain all expended uses when you finish a short or long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Nerve Block Buffer
entries: In the heat of the moment, you inject some numbing medicine to have someone feel less pain. Starting at 10th level when you use {@subclassFeature First Aid|Fighter||Battle Medic|FFBattleMedic|3}, you can give the creature you heal temporary hit points equal to the total amount of hit points restored. Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Don't Die On Me
entries: Starting at 15th level you are able to get a fallen ally back in relative fighting shape. When you use {@subclassFeature First Aid|Fighter||Battle Medic|FFBattleMedic|3} on a creature that is at 0 hit points, instead of rolling, you use the maximum number possible for each die you spend.

subclassFeature.name: Miracle Worker
entries: You try to bring someone back from the clutches of death. You can try to resuscitate a creature who has been dead for no more than 10 minutes with 1 minute of work. You must expend two uses of a {@item healer's kit|PHB} you have on your person and make a DC 20 Wisdom ({@skill Medicine}) check.

If the check is successful, the creature comes back to life with 1 hit point, but is {@condition unconscious} for {@dice 1d6} hours. When the creature wakes up, they gain 1 level of {@condition exhaustion}.
You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Wisdom modifier (minimum of once), and regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.
